intro: Verbesina cayucensis, commonly known as Cayucan goldenrod, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, often appearing in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Verbesina cayucensis is often found in moist, open habitats such as riverbanks and savannas.
